summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing the production of discovery materials. The production includes search warrant returns and data from electronic devices, notably an iPhone seized from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his 2019 arrest.

persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, recipient of the discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (20 Cr. 330 (MN)), for whom discovery materials are being produced.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the individual from whom an iPhone (Subject Device-2) was seized by law enforcement at the time of his arrest in 2019. Data from this device is part of the discovery production.

connections.description: Implicitly connected as the discovery in Maxwell's case includes data from a device seized from Epstein, suggesting their alleged criminal association is central to the investigation.
Everdell is listed as defense counsel receiving discovery on behalf of Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Law enforcement seized an iPhone from Jeffrey Epstein at the time of his arrest.

events.title: Discovery Production to Maxwell Defense
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a hard drive and CD containing discovery materials, including search warrant returns and data from electronic devices, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., 150 East Tenth Avenue, Denver, CO 80203
Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim, 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document confirms that data from an iPhone seized from Jeffrey Epstein at his 2019 arrest was part of the discovery material produced in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The production includes extensive search warrant returns (SDNY_PROD015 parts 1-7 and SDNY_PROD016), all designated as confidential.
A chart lists over 60 subject devices searched pursuant to warrants, indicating the scale of the digital evidence collection in the investigation.
The letter is governed by a protective order, highlighting the sensitive nature of the materials being exchanged.
Technical difficulties delayed the full review and production of images from Epstein's iPhone until November 17, 2020.
